radiographic_examinations.findings: Pulmonary embolism in the right lung, with occlusion of the interlobar pulmonary artery extending into the middle and lower lobes, including segmental arteries. New focal dilatation (1.1 cm in diameter) of the pulmonary artery in the left lower lobe and a new small right pleural effusion.

Large pulmonary embolus occluding the distal right main pulmonary artery. Previously identified pulmonary emboli had not resolved. Dilatation of the pulmonary artery in the left lower lobe with a thrombus had not changed.

Right main pulmonary artery completely occluded by thromboembolic material. Several areas of consolidation that likely represent evolving infarcts. Thrombosed subsegmental artery in the left lower lobe in the area of the previously identified dilatation.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging of the chest
radiographic_examinations.findings: Almost complete occlusion of the distal right main pulmonary artery and bilateral segmental and subsegmental pulmonary arteries consistent with thromboembolism. A new aneurysm (2.4 cm in diameter) of the pulmonary artery in the lateral basal segment of the left lower lobe containing eccentric thromboembolic material. Enlarging pulmonary infarcts in the right lung with a small amount of adjacent loculated pleural fluid.
Increase in the size of the pulmonary artery aneurysm.
